column5: Roy was having a hard time with Photobucket so I hosted the pictures of the snow for him that he took from Quebec today.  Now that's alot of snow!!!!!
now that is what winter used to be like.....wow that's a lot of snow
And in other news............
Wow no wonder we only got 3 inches here it seems it all fell up North on the way down.   Art
Thanks Joey. Yeah, I'm powering up Bertha in a bit. That hump on the back deck is not a piece of furniture....it's snow and wind.
Oy vey!  Bertha is in for a work out!
Looks like a Good Ole' Fashion Dusting. Bring a roll of trail tape with ya if you leave the house.
I'd be out ripping around town on my sled!!!    :good:

Wow !!! That's a good old fashioned winter snowstorm !!!! I wish we had that here !!!! We only got 6 inches I guess here in bobcaygeon !!! But the sled trails are starting to open up Roy I would be tearing up and around with my sled in all that powder !!!! Your snowblower is gonna need another tank of gas !!!! Don't hurt yourself ....
My Pomeranian stepped off the deck and disappeared:w00t: Thank god my Lab is a trained Pom Rescue dog. She went in after her, and made a trail back to the stairs.

Yep...4 to 6 inches just east of Bobcaygeon...My neighbor across the street plowed out the end of our driveway...Thank God for good neighbors...Maribeth will have to make him some of her world-famous chocolate chip cookies...  I have to go get my bandages removed, stitches out and my new pacemaker regulated tomorrow afternoon...   Even afterwards I'm not to lift my left arm above my shoulder and no heavy lifting or work for another 6 to 8 weeks...  I should get my driving privileges back tomorrow then I will drive the truck back and forth over the driveway to pack the snow down to save throwing up gravel with the snowblower...
Jeez Norm, hope all is well.  Sounds like you've had a few rough weeks.  Please take care, I'll be thinking of you!!!
fresh.. Virgin.. POW!!

My oldest came back through there yesterday, Saguenay to Barrie, 16 hours that normally takes him about 9.  Far to many dingbat drivers that think they're Villeneuve and probably over a 100 in the ditches.
Needed to put the electric start on Bertha yesterday and shock her back to life!
Guy's you've got to get your selves a ride on ........
It's all clean now. Finished the last bits this morning. Finished 'til the next snowfall but after this one, anything under 12" is not even worth cleaning.
Spoken like a true sno guy now Roy ........ lol .
LOL its a good thing that didnt happen in Toronto...
And in other news ...... it was another gorgeous day in the Bahamas. You know, where you don't need a post hole auger in order to fish.
And to think aI was complaining 'bout the snow that fell yesterday here in Hamilton.  I feel shame...
